page.title: 10Buildings on Beeley Moor
page.content: These are built of local gritstone and all are over 100 years old. Two date from 1645. All have benn renovated and modernised. {AMMENITIES:-}the Hipper valley farms are on a reasonable 'B' class road. The other farms are approximately 1/4 - 1/2 mile from a 'B' class road. These roads are always kept open during periods of snow. All the farms are approximately 2 miles from a bus service. Cars are the main form of transport and the school bus where necessary. Refuse is collected fort- nightly. Three farms have cesspools and two have septic tanks. All have electricity but no gas is available except bottled gas. Four farms have a daily newspaper delivered by the postman and four use the mobile library. Shopping is done in Matlock, Chesterfield, Bakewell and Clay Cross.
